intro: Pectis saturejoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, pale blue or purple flowers during the spring and summer months. Pectis saturejoides is adapted to arid conditions and has a deep root system to access moisture.
